intro: Cacalia mucronulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, showy flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cacalia mucronulata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny conditions.
